entity1.name: Climate change
entity1.description: A significant alteration in the state of the Earth's climate that can persist for an extended period, typically decades or longer.

entity3.name: global temperatures
entity3.description: A measure of the average heat content of the Earth's atmosphere, oceans, and land surfaces.

entity4.name: weather patterns
entity4.description: The prevailing or typical atmospheric conditions in a particular place over time.

entity5.name: animals
entity5.description: A broad category of living organisms that are multicellular, eukaryotic, and capable of locomotion at some stage in their lives.

entity6.name: species
entity6.description: A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding.

entity7.name: extinction
entity7.description: The process by which a species or other taxonomic unit ceases to exist, often due to environmental changes or human activities.

entity8.name: climate change

entity12.name: habitat
entity12.description: The natural home or environment where an organism lives, which provides the necessary conditions for its survival.

entity13.name: Rising temperatures
entity13.description: An increase in the average temperature of a region or globally, often associated with climate change.

entity14.name: Changing precipitation patterns
entity14.description: Alterations in the distribution and frequency of rainfall or other forms of precipitation over time, which can affect water availability and ecosystems.

entity15.name: Ecosystems
entity15.description: Communities of living organisms (plants, animals, and microbes) in conjunction with the nonliving components of their environment (air, water, and mineral soil), interacting as a system.

entity16.name: Species
entity16.description: A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding.

entity17.name: polar bears
entity17.description: A large bear species native to the Arctic, known for their white fur and ability to hunt on sea ice.

entity18.name: Arctic
entity18.description: The northernmost region of Earth, characterized by its cold climate, polar ice cap, and unique wildlife.

entity20.name: plants
entity20.description: Multicellular organisms that are capable of photosynthesis, forming a major part of the earth's biomass and ecosystems.

entity21.name: animals
entity21.description: Multicellular organisms that form the biological kingdom Animalia, characterized by their ability to move voluntarily and respond to stimuli.

entity22.name: food
entity22.description: Any nutritious substance consumed to maintain life and growth in living organisms.

entity23.name: ocean temperatures
entity23.description: The temperature of the ocean water, which can affect marine ecosystems.

entity24.name: coral bleaching
entity24.description: A process where corals lose their color and symbiotic algae due to stress, often caused by increased water temperatures.

entity25.name: coral reefs
entity25.description: Underwater ecosystems formed by colonies of coral polyps, providing shelter and food for various marine species.

entity26.name: fish
entity26.description: A diverse group of aquatic animals that rely on coral reefs for their habitat and sustenance.

entity27.name: food webs
entity27.description: A system of interlocking and interdependent food chains in an ecosystem, showing the complex interactions between organisms and their environment.

entity28.name: species
entity28.description: A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding. The species is the principal natural taxonomic unit, ranking below a genus and denoted by a Latin binomial.

entity29.name: climate change
entity29.description: A significant and lasting change in the statistical distribution of weather patterns over periods ranging from decades to millions of years.

entity30.name: hurricanes
entity30.description: Intense tropical storms that form over warm ocean waters and can cause significant damage with strong winds, heavy rain, and storm surges.

entity31.name: droughts
entity31.description: Periods of below-average precipitation in a given region, resulting in water shortages for ecosystems and human use.

entity32.name: wildfires
entity32.description: Uncontrolled fires that often occur in forested or wooded areas, capable of causing extensive damage to property and wildlife.

entity33.name: animal populations
entity33.description: Groups of animals of the same species living in a particular area or habitat.

entity34.name: Australia
entity34.description: A country and continent located in the Southern Hemisphere, known for its diverse wildlife and unique landscapes.

entity35.name: koalas
entity35.description: A tree-dwelling marsupial native to Australia, known for its distinctive appearance and diet of eucalyptus leaves.

entity38.name: diseases
entity38.description: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury.

entity39.name: parasites
entity39.description: Organisms that live on or in an organism of another species, known as the host, and get at least part of their nutrition from it.

entity40.name: Warmer temperatures
entity40.description: An increase in ambient temperature that can affect ecosystems and living organisms.

entity41.name: disease-causing organisms
entity41.description: Microorganisms capable of causing diseases in animals or plants.

entity42.name: outbreaks

entity51.description: Areas that are situated at a greater height above sea level compared to surrounding areas.

entity52.description: Lower temperature conditions, often sought by organisms for survival and comfort.

entity57.name: Governments

entity60.name: animals
entity60.description: Multicellular eukaryotic organisms that form the biological kingdom Animalia. They are characterized by their ability to move, respond to stimuli, and maintain homeostasis.

entity61.name: ecosystems
entity61.description: A community of living organisms (plants, animals, and microbes) in conjunction with the nonliving components of their environment (air, water, and mineral soil), interacting as a system.

entity62.name: habitat loss
entity62.description: The reduction of natural habitats due to human activities or climate change, leading to a decrease in biodiversity.

entity63.name: food shortages
entity63.description: A situation where there is not enough food available for all members of a population, often due to environmental or economic factors.

entity64.name: extreme weather events
entity64.description: Severe and unusual weather conditions that can cause significant damage and disruption to ecosystems and human societies.

entity65.name: diseases
entity65.description: Conditions or illnesses that affect the health of organisms, which can spread more easily due to environmental changes.

entity66.name: warming planet
entity66.description: The increase in Earth's average surface temperature due to human activities and natural processes, leading to global climate change.

entity67.name: animal populations
entity67.description: Groups of animals that live together or are found within a specific geographic area, often affected by environmental changes.

entity68.name: Earth
entity68.description: The third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to support life.
